Your SEL resource for today:
Many children have a hard time expressing themselves verbally or do not have a parent or loved one they trust to talk to about their feelings. It‚Äôs important to explain to these children that they do not have to talk about their worries or stress if these topics make them uncomfortable, but they do have to find a different outlet for expressing themselves. Have children decorate a journal that is personal to them using stickers, markers, or even magazine cut-outs of positive phrases, and encourage them to write in their journal any time they feel the need.

Journal Prompts:
1. What are you afraid of?
2. Why is it good for us to talk about our emotions?
3. What are some ways you have managed worry, fear, and anxiety in the past? 4. What helps you when you are feeling anxious or worried?
5. How are you feeling about the Coronavirus? Are you worried?
6. How can you flip the switch from being worried to being grateful?
7. How do you elevate your perspective in times of worry?
8. Who on your dream team can you talk to if you are anxious or fearful?

Parents of South Elementary students --

If you plan to pick up your child after school, we have updated our procedures! These changes will ensure safety for our students and will hopefully create a smoother process overall. Check out the diagram below for instructions! Some things to note:

* We will mark 3 lanes (one for each grade level). If you have siblings in multiple grades, just choose a line to use throughout the year.

* Teachers will be walking students to their cars, and all traffic will remain STOPPED until given a signal to go. This will help maintain safety for all students and faculty.

* Do not park in the parking lot. Please pull into one of the corresponding lanes.

* Any students whose parents are parked elsewhere (i.e. along Elliott, Shelton, etc.) will be considered walkers. For safety concerns, they will be the last students released to go.

Thank you for your cooperation! We look forward to a great year!!

Breckenridge ISD
February 22, 2018 at 12:28 PM ¬∑ Breckenridge, TX ¬∑

THURSDAY WEATHER UPDATE

While we were optimistic temperatures would allow for some thawing this morning, it appears that will not happen in time for a 10am start.

BISD will remain closed, Thursday.

Administration will begin working on a plan to address missed time, as this closing will take us over the allowable limits. Thank you for your patience as we try to make the best decisions possible for our kids and community. That often means waiting until weather presents itself, rather than reacting to forecasts which are not always accurate.

Tim Seymore
Superintendent
